title: City’s $211m world record solution to No.1 problem
text:
EPL transfer news: Manchester City to make world record bid for goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma March 23, 2017 11:01am Source: FOX SPORTS PEP Guardiola looks set to solve his goalkeeping problems by making a world record bid for AC Milan youngster Gianluigi Donnarumma. 
That’s according to Sky Sports Italia (via Football Italia ), who report City’s search for a new number one could see them bid a mammoth €150 million (£130.3m, AU$211.1m) to secure the 18-year-old’s signature. 
City currently have Claudio Bravo, Willy Caballero and Joe Hart (on loan) on the books, but Cabellero’s contract expires at the end of the current season, while Hart is almost certain to leave the club permanently in the off-season. 
That leaves just Bravo, whose inconsistent performances saw him lose his starting spot. 
It has been suggested City will be willing to offer between €120-150m for Donnarumma, as speculation rises of his exit. AC Milan's goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma has been linked to Manchester City. Source: AFP 
Tipped as the successor to legendary Gianluigi Buffon, Donnarumma’s contract with AC Milan has just over one year to run, but negotiations have stalled due to uncertainty over the club’s ownership situation. 
A move to Manchester for the figure mooted would smash the previous record transfer fee for a goalkeeper, still held by Buffon when Juventus paid £32.6m to Parma back in 2001. 
It was also dwarf Manchester United’s £89m forked out for Paul Pogba in 2016, with Donnarumma having already played 63 times for AC Milan despite only just turning 18. Gianluigi Donnarumma has made more saves (111) than any other goalkeeper in Europe's top 5 leagues this season.Reminder: He's only 18. pic.twitter.com/MjKKa169xv — Squawka Football (@Squawka) March 14, 2017 
Donnarumma made his first team debut for AC Milan at 16 years and 242 days and has gone on to cement himself as their undisputed No.1. He has also made two appearances for Italy, becoming their youngest ever goalkeeper at 17 years and 189 days. Gianluigi Donnarumma with legendary Juventus and Italy goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon.
